timeline.message:
FCCEUD-18: Describe module metadata

Issue ID: FCCEUD-18
Issue Link: https://projects.engineering.redhat.com/browse/FCCEUD-18

* Create module "Module metadata in Pantheon"

Describe module metadata

* Add examples of intrinsic and extrinsic metadata.

timeline.bodyText:
A descrition list makes more sense to me here:
Intrinsic:: Metadata that is automatically inferred from the module.
timeline.author: robin-owen
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,24 @@
+[id="module-metadata-in-pantheon_{context}"]
+= Module metadata in {ProductShortName}
+
+Each module in {ProductShortName} has associated metadata for search engine optimization (SEO). SEO improves the findability of modules.  
+
+There are two types of module-metadata in {ProductShortName}:
+
+* Intrinsic:

replies.bodyText: Agree, this looks to be the better option. Changed.
replies.author: theashiot

timeline.bodyText: Likewise, I'd use a description list here. :)
timeline.author: robin-owen
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,24 @@
+[id="module-metadata-in-pantheon_{context}"]
+= Module metadata in {ProductShortName}
+
+Each module in {ProductShortName} has associated metadata for search engine optimization (SEO). SEO improves the findability of modules.  
+
+There are two types of module-metadata in {ProductShortName}:
+
+* Intrinsic:
++
+The metadata that is inferred from the module automatically.
++
+Example of intrinsic metadata include the following:
+
+** Module name
+** Module description
+
+* Extrinsic:

timeline.bodyText: The hyphen is unnecessary in "product version".
timeline.author: robin-owen
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,24 @@
+[id="module-metadata-in-pantheon_{context}"]
+= Module metadata in {ProductShortName}
+
+Each module in {ProductShortName} has associated metadata for search engine optimization (SEO). SEO improves the findability of modules.  
+
+There are two types of module-metadata in {ProductShortName}:
+
+* Intrinsic:
++
+The metadata that is inferred from the module automatically.
++
+Example of intrinsic metadata include the following:
+
+** Module name
+** Module description
+
+* Extrinsic:
++
+The metadata that is applied manually before publishing.
++
+Examples of extrinsic metadata include the following:
+
+** Product name - the product and the product-version that the module should be published for.

timeline.author: robin-owen

replies.bodyText:
Also, should we explicitly say "two types", or should we just preface the list with a generic statement?
The types of module metadata in {ProductShortName} are as follows:
replies.author: robin-owen

replies.bodyText: removed hyphen. Agree with not saying two types explicitly, changed as suggested.
replies.author: theashiot

* Apply peer-review feedback
